text:
(1)
North (Hudson) River, showing pier 81 of the Hudson River Day Line, off Twelfth Ave., at the foot of West 41st Street.
August 31, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date, as seen from the shore.
October 31, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 1, another angle. Prominent buildings seen are the R.C.A. tower and the McGraw-Hill Building.
July 19, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
title: North (Hudson) River - Pier 81 of the Hudson Day Line.

text:
1. New York Central freight yards, Twelfth Avenue, east side, from 41st to 42nd Streets, view east. March 17, 1929.

2. The same, four years later. August 29, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

1. New York Central freight yards, Twelfth Avenue, east side, from 41st to 42nd Streets, view east. March 17, 1929.

2. The same, four years later. August 29, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

Twelfth Avenue, west side, north from 41st Street.
October 31, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

North (Hudson) River, showing the pier (center of view) between West 42nd and West 41st Streets, off Twelfth Ave. (no pier number). This pier was demolished between 1930 and 1934. Also shown (extreme right) is part of pier 81. The view is in a southwesterly direction from the edge of the West New York (N.J.) Ferry at the foot of West 42nd Street. April 8, 1931. P. L. Sperr.
title: North (Hudson) River - Manhattan - 12th Avenue - Pier between 41st and 42nd Streets.
